channel.title: Comments on: The 3 Greatest Tech/Geek Movies Of All Time

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/04/22/the-3-greatest-techgeek-movies-of-all-time/#comment-2835">Mark T</a>.
Real Genius is pretty good.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Mark T.

Real Genius is pretty good.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/04/22/the-3-greatest-techgeek-movies-of-all-time/#comment-2833">Jim</a>.
'The Net', the movie that taught everyone to beware of the Pi symbol!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Jim.

‘The Net’, the movie that taught everyone to beware of the Pi symbol!

item.title: By: Jim
item.dc:creator: Jim
item.description:
Your old office mates just held the first "IT Movie Night" last Friday. Our feature presentation was Sneakers! (Especially appropriate given the CSU-wide security audit we're going through.)
I totally agree with your comments re Hackers. If you want to see a *really* bad "tech/geek" movie, try The Net. (gag!)
item.content:encoded:
Your old office mates just held the first “IT Movie Night” last Friday. Our feature presentation was Sneakers! (Especially appropriate given the CSU-wide security audit we’re going through.)

I totally agree with your comments re Hackers. If you want to see a *really* bad “tech/geek” movie, try The Net. (gag!)

item.title: By: George Serradinho
item.dc:creator: George Serradinho
item.description:
Hi there,
I loved Wargames, I must say that I have watched it many times and I still don't get bored. I must mention that Star Wars is probably one of my fav's and I still watch them today.
item.content:encoded:
Hi there,

I loved Wargames, I must say that I have watched it many times and I still don’t get bored. I must mention that Star Wars is probably one of my fav’s and I still watch them today.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/04/22/the-3-greatest-techgeek-movies-of-all-time/#comment-2829">Elizabeth Scott</a>.
I might have the 20th anniversary DVD, I'll have to check. And if I'm going to get it out I may as well watch it again :-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Elizabeth Scott.

I might have the 20th anniversary DVD, I’ll have to check. And if I’m going to get it out I may as well watch it again ðŸ™‚

item.title: By: velda
item.dc:creator: velda
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/04/22/the-3-greatest-techgeek-movies-of-all-time/#comment-2828">Joseph Scott</a>.
The matrix really was pretty exciting, but very unrealistic and I didn't think the trippiness factor was as great as everyone says, but it was very computer geeky nonetheless.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

The matrix really was pretty exciting, but very unrealistic and I didn’t think the trippiness factor was as great as everyone says, but it was very computer geeky nonetheless.

item.title: By: Elizabeth Scott
item.dc:creator: Elizabeth Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/04/22/the-3-greatest-techgeek-movies-of-all-time/#comment-2820">Joseph Scott</a>.
I don't know what your DVD has but mine is a 2 disc 20th Anniversary Collector's Edition that was released in 2002. It's got LOTS of goodies! Commentaries, deleted scenes, "making of" type stuff, storyboards, etc. Not to mention you could watch it in Spanish or FRENCH! That's when you know you've got a really snazzy edition!
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Joseph Scott.

I don’t know what your DVD has but mine is a 2 disc 20th Anniversary Collector’s Edition that was released in 2002. It’s got LOTS of goodies! Commentaries, deleted scenes, “making of” type stuff, storyboards, etc. Not to mention you could watch it in Spanish or FRENCH! That’s when you know you’ve got a really snazzy edition!

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/04/22/the-3-greatest-techgeek-movies-of-all-time/#comment-2824">Michael Moncur</a>.
Having only watched some of "The Matrix" on TV I don't have a full comparison, but it strikes me as being at least as much fantasy as Tron was.
item.content:encoded:
In reply to Michael Moncur.

Having only watched some of “The Matrix” on TV I don’t have a full comparison, but it strikes me as being at least as much fantasy as Tron was.

item.title: By: Joseph Scott
item.dc:creator: Joseph Scott
item.description:
In reply to <a href="/2009/04/22/the-3-greatest-techgeek-movies-of-all-time/#comment-2815">velda</a>.
I actually watched most of Hackers recently. It had glimmers of being a good geek movie, but those moments were over shadowed by the entire rest of the film :-)
item.content:encoded:
In reply to velda.

I actually watched most of Hackers recently. It had glimmers of being a good geek movie, but those moments were over shadowed by the entire rest of the film ðŸ™‚
